intro: Erigeron glabellus, commonly known as the white fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows, prairies, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers bloom in late summer to early fall. The species is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions and is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value.
